meanings.sent1: She queened her best friend during the game of make-believe.
meanings.sent2: The fairy godmother queened Cinderella with a wave of her wand.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, Sarah queened her cat by placing a crown on its head.
meanings.sent4: The magical necklace queened the wearer, granting them royal powers.
meanings.sent5: In the story, the young girl queened her doll, pretending it ruled over a tiny kingdom.

meanings.definition: To act or behave like a queen.
meanings.sent1: During the play, Emma queened on stage, commanding attention with her presence.
meanings.sent2: The little girl queened around the house, pretending to give royal orders to her toys.
meanings.sent3: In the school play, the boy queened around, pretending to be a royal ruler of a magical land.
meanings.sent4: The cat queened on the windowsill, surveying its kingdom of the backyard.
meanings.sent5: The actor queened on the red carpet, waving to fans as if they were loyal subjects.
